alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:35AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kimball and southeastern Laramie Counties through 615 AM MDT... At 534 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hillsdale to near Carpenter. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Burns, Hillsdale, Panorama Point, Carpenter and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 378 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
